textPieces.text: This release has a few improvements of the User Interface:
From the Settings page it is now possible to specify a number of systems for easy access and Progress trace info can now be inspected.
Internally, the code and its organization has been completely refactored and/or rewritten to make it easier to add new features and to make the code more maintainable.
This is the first real release of NSO Mobile. It is still very much a work in progress, but it is now at a point where it can be useful for some people. It contains the following features:
For devices and packages, not all of the information is shown yet, but it is a start.
To view debug info, the nso_dbg package must be loaded in NSO.
NSO Mobile is an experimental application that allows you to view the alarms, devices, packages and debug info from your NSO system.
It is built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, mainly as an exercise in learning these technologies.
